subject: The Ladder
event:
HBO rolled out a new promo for season three of GAME OF THRONES tonight.

Did you miss it?

No problem.

Enjoy.

<lj-embed id="347" />

comments.article: "No-one knows where the ladder goes, You're gonna lose what you love the most..." "They were friends of mine"... (Bright Eyes)

I just watched this 10 times in <10 minutes.

AMAZING. ♥
So excited!!
Lovely, simple and very effective :)
goosebumps. goosebumps all over.
Seven hells, i'll have to wait for ages until season 3 runs in german free tv...but at least there's a ray of hope as season 2 runs at second weekend of march...yay!
I would love to see you ( or hear you) in a Game Of Thrones Teaser !
By the way, Eagles just restructured Vick for one more year.  Hope that calms your fears for your Jets.  As an Eagles fan, I am furious.  Sigh.
comments.subject: Michael Vick

comments.upictitle: embers_log: GoT Tyrion Imping is Hard
comments.article: I really love this promo, I particularly love Peter Dinklage's little smile at the end there!  LOL
I'm not sure why he would be smiling though
I can not wait! *reads all the books again while he waits*
comments.subject: Ooooh yeah :)

comments.article: Wow, I wish I could read them that quickly.
comments.subject: Re: Ooooh yeah :)

comments.article:
Damn it!

Epic, I just can't wait! 48 days left...
robb stark is such a boss...god damn
Actually I didn't miss it, I don't watch the promos/teasers because I prefer to watch the scenes as they come up. The promos are just for marketing, I would rather watch the series in the proper way.

GRRM,

Can you please incorporate more of a history and back story to the series? It seems as if there are less and less as we go on. I'd like to know whatever happen to the Edric Dayne.
comments.subject: Ice and Fire

comments.article:
That was pretty spine chilling. But honestly, when I saw Arya's face on that video link, I half imagined that the entire teaser was a shot of her reading her names:

...the tickler and the hound... King Joffery... Queen Cersei

... and then she'd just look right at the camera and say, "Valar Morghulis!"

And no music either, during any part of it. You wouldn't need it.

But then that would probably be TOO spine chilling. :)

*laugh*
Yeah, like it needs advertising!
Ikr? Like why are they bothering. We're all sitting at the edge of our collective seat already.
Great and effective close ups of the actors! Beautifully sinister voiceover... Yep, GoT returns!

Great promo . . . very moody.

I hope some of the readers of Not a Blog will be attending the Deeper than Swords exhibit, dinner, lecture and signing, at Texas A&M University, 20-21 March (<http://deeperthanswords.library.tamu.edu/>).

Do we need a secret sign to identify ourselves?

Leslie, the Librarian
comments.subject: Promo & Deeper than Swords

comments.article: I've been waiting so long, I forgot what i was waiting for! 1 month more!
comments.subject: The Wait

comments.article: Off topic, but I'm gonna start reading the Wild Cards books. Does it matter the order? Any suggestions would be great.

You can start with volume one, WILD CARDS, for the original series.

Or you can start with INSIDE STRAIGHT, first of the "next generation" books.

Or you can start with FORT FREAK, the most recent volume, which shifts the focus to a different cast of characters.

Wherever you begin, enjoy the read.

Do you know why the writers of the TV show invented Talisa to fill the place of Jeyne Westerling? The whole Talisa plotline was such a fuck up and it made Robb look like a complete idiot and not like his father's son (which is a shame because I really loved Robb in the books).

Robb is "off stage" for almost the entirety of A CLASH OF KINGS. D&D did not want to shelve Richard Madden for an entire season. I think that was a good decision.

Also, they found an amazing actress to play his love interest.

They gave her a different story than the one I used in the books, however. I was the one who advocated the name change, once I learned that she was to be from Volantis. "Jeyne" is not a Volantene name.

I really like the book and the series of articles I am a big fan. All I wanted to be a volume that uses a self signed by the first episode, I hope that one day in Hungary will be signed. Sincerely, Mark Meszaros 18 years old boy from Hungary.
comments.subject: We would be honored if you read it.

comments.article:
I'm not keen on this promo. Only because something about it feels contrived. Sorry, I HATE to be critical because everything about you shines gold in mine eyes, Ser Martin.

Perhaps it reminds me of the very awkward Claire Forlani, Dewar's "Drinking Man's Scotch" TV Spots.

The Rains of Castamere Promo is So incredible, it gives me chills every time I hear/see it. Wait till the non readers see the connection...the blogs are gonna blow UP!! I wept (again) this time listening to that chapter by way of book-on-tape last week.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UlYfiQLpC3Q

When will you be in NY Ser George? I'd love to meet you (And dear Ser Peter D, if possible) & have you sign books, to me. :)
comments.subject: I prefer The Rains of Castamere Promo

comments.article: Cant see your video but the promo I saw was really awesome.
comments.subject: Promo
